description.narrative: Omprogrammerade medel för att bekämpa covid-19 Insatsen syftar till att stärka det syriska civilsamhällets (SCS) förmåga att agera som en kraft för demokratisk förändring, fred och stabilitet, för att stödja övergångsrättvisa, och att främja respekt för mänskliga rättigheter och medborgerliga friheter genom projektstöd till mindre organisationer, kapacitetsstöd och påverkansarbete.

Reprogrammed funds to address COVID-19 The intervention aims at strengthening the Syrian civil society (SCS) capacities to act as a force for democratic change, inclusive peace and stability, to support transitional justice, and to promote respect for human rights and civil liberties using different tools and approaches including advocacy, lobbying and policy making".

The intended outcome of this programme is "Syrian civil society (SCS) capacities are strengthened to act as a force for democratic change, inclusive peace and stability, to support transitional justice, and to promote respect for human rights and civil liberties using different tools and approaches including advocacy, lobbying and policy making". This programme includes 3 projects, Syria Inline, Syria Online and Syria Outline. Each of the projects has a specific objective: 1) Syria Inline has the following overall goal: Syrian civil society (SCS) is empowered and skilled to take the role of influential and effective agents of peace, stability and positive change in their communities and in Syrian society. and the following objectives: - Build the capacities of Syrian initiatives, and CBOs to transfer them from nascent organizations to developed and sustained ones. - Support Syrian initiatives, CBOs, and CSOs with the needed resources to implement programs that would affect local contexts and national dialogue and policy. - Support networking between members of Syrian civil society to increase communication and effectiveness and provide the needed resources to implement joint actions by Syrian civil society member organizations. 2) Syria Online has the following overall goal: Syrians have access to a safe and secure online platform where they acquire skills, knowledge, and resources, and empower each other to take the role of influential and effective agents of peace, stability and positive change in their communities and in Syrian society. and the following objectives: - To support safe online networking among Syrian individuals and initiate online discussions and dialogue. - To build the capacities of Syrian individuals and increase their knowledge of democracy, human rights, and civil society; and enhance their professional, organizational, and technical skillsets. - To support Syrians with the needed resources to create content that would enrich the Syria Online platform and the discussions held therein. 3) Syria Outline has the following overall goal: To empower Syrians, especially women and youth, whether in neighboring or host countries, to amplify the voices of Syrians inside Syria and advocate for their causes and rights and to support networks of active advocates for Syrian civil society positions and policy recommendations. and the following objectives: - To support active networks of Syrian CSOs, policy and decision makers, and individuals especially women and youth to increase participation in decision making, public affairs, and policy making in elevating Syrian voices from the ground and bridging and linking Syrians inside and outside. - To build the capacities of Syrian CSOs, and individuals and increase their knowledge on advocacy, building networks and initiatives, and political and civic participation. - To support Syrian individuals with the needed resources to implement advocacy campaigns or initiatives that would affect policy making or promote joint positions and messages amplifying voices from the ground.

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

description.narrative: The project is in its' first year. Tangible results will be presented in the first annual report March 2021 (including Nov-Dec 2019).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
